result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon Deen Lashley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:09 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gordon Deen Lashley in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Gordon Deen Lashley. Atty. Satorius recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 3 - Retail Theft w/ repeater modifier. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 - Retail Theft w/ repeater modifier. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses and reads in Cts 1 and 2. Sentencing arguments.

Crt orders: 
Ct 3 - Retail Theft w/ repeater modifier
I/S 8 months jail - Huber not authorized
1 year probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment. 
- Maintain employment
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Restitution $6.29 payable to Fleet Farm; payable through DOC
- Court Costs $243; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through DOC

2 days jail credit
Defendant to report to probation by today
Adjourned. kma
Filed by DA Anderson. km
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Information will mirror the Criminal Complaint.  DF waives his in person appearance.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Bond continues.  Adjourned: 2:13

DF updates his address.  DF wishes to waive the Preliminary Hearing.  DF waives his right to an in-person appearance.   Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Hudson Fleet Farm.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

DE updates address and confirms DOB.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. DE waives speedy prelim. DE has other cases in Chippewa County, PD represents on those matters.  Adjourned 1:33 PM. bph  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
